text:
THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY
TELECOMMUNICATIONS CENTER
Richard B. Hull, Executive Director
WOSU TELEVISION
2470 North Star Road
Columbus 21, Ohio
August 27, 1962
Mr. Hardd Hill
Vice President
N.A.E.B.
1346 Connecticut Ave., N.W.
Washington 6, D.C.
Dear Harold:
1*m getting in a bind on dates and times — down to the hour, it looks
like, in a couple of cases. Can you give me as much detail as you have
on starting and stopping times at the NAEB annual meeting in Philadelphia?
For instance, I know that the session opens Sunday, October 21 with a
12:45 - 2:45 p.m. session for directors and constituents followed by a
board meeting. In the event I have to shave things at the end of the
session, give me the dope on the last two days - banquet time, and ending
time on October 24th. Will appreciate this much.
Sincerely,
Richard B. Hul1
RBH:rc
P. Incidentally, one of the things Ray Hurlbert and I were discussing
s. after Bill came to our dinner (and you were occupied fully for a
moment with Bill), was the matter of who the ranking director might be
in a given region with both Radio and TV directors. For instance, because
he is senior to me in III, l let Jim Miles take the lead in general
regional activity. Ray Hurlbert and Leonard Presse work together. This
is not to suggest that I do not work with Jim (witness his excellent
Region III meeting this spring in which we cooperated), but I have not
pushed the TV boys in III. While this may represent a deficiency the
thing possibly does need some thinking through and spelling out. Ray*s
extraordinary activity in II brings the problem to focus.
Teaching Aids Laboratory •
RBH
